alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 4:52PM MST until January 19 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Patchy freezing drizzle transitioning to light snow will lead to continued slick conditions on roadways. Up to a half inch of additional snow accumulation possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, and northeast Colorado. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Icy roads will make travel very difficult especially over bridges and overpasses. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org Sidewalks may be icy and very slippery. Walk on grassy areas or avoid sidewalks if icy.
